alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 5:14AM EDT until March 26 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. .A strong storm system has produced moderate to heavy rainfall. This rainfall has resulted in rises on rivers and streams. More rain is forecast over the next next 24 hours.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-252115- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.Y.0002.000000T0000Z-230326T0600Z/ /PTTP1.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 514 AM EDT Sat Mar 25 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to below 18 feet tonight. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
